page.title: List of presidential trips made by Barack Obama during 2010

revision.text:
{{main|Presidency of Barack Obama}} [[File:Silvio Berlusconi Barack Obama Jose Manuel Barroso Angela Merkel and Nicolas Sarkozy cropped 36th G8 summit member 20100625.jpg|thumb|President Obama with European leaders during the [[36th G8 summit]] in [[Huntsville, Ontario]], [[Canada]] in June 2010.]] This is a '''list of presidential trips made by [[Barack Obama]] during 2010''', the second year of [[Presidency of Barack Obama|his presidency]] as the [[List of Presidents of the United States|44th]] [[President of the United States]]. During 2010, Obama traveled to eight different [[sovereign state|nation state]]s internationally, in addition to many more trips made domestically within the [[United States]]. This list excludes trips made within [[Washington, D.C.]], the U.S. federal capital in which the [[White House]], the official residence and principal workplace of the President, is located. Additionally excluded are trips to [[Camp David]], the country residence of the President, and to the private home of the [[Family of Barack Obama|Obama family]] in [[Kenwood, Chicago]]. ==January== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flagicon|Delaware}} ''[[Delaware]]'' |[[Wilmington, Delaware|Wilmington]] |January 12 |President Obama traveled to Wilmington, Delaware, to attend the funeral of Jean Biden, mother of [[Vice President of the United States|Vice President]] [[Joe Biden]].{{Cite news|title=Biden eulogizes mother, calls her courageous |first=Randall |last=Chase |date=12 January 2010 |accessdate=12 January 2010 |agency=Associated Press |url=http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/sdut-biden-eulogizes-mother-calls-her-courageous-2010jan12-story.html}} |- |{{Flagicon|Massachusetts}} ''[[Massachusetts]]'' |[[Boston]] |January 17 |President Obama traveled to Boston, Massachusetts, to campaign for [[Martha Coakley]] in the [[United States Senate special election in Massachusetts, 2010|Senate special election]].{{Cite news|title=Obama scrambles to save Democratic Senate seat |agency=[[Reuters]] |first=Matthew |last=Spetalnick |date=17 January 2010 |accessdate=17 January 2010 |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE60C5HD20100117}} |- |{{Flagicon|Ohio}} ''[[Ohio]] |[[Elyria, Ohio|Elyria]] |January 22 |President Obama traveled to Elyria, Ohio, visiting the [[Lorain County Community College]] and emphasizing his political agenda.{{Cite news|title=In Ohio, Obama vows to 'never stop fighting'|first=Ed|last=Henry|date=January 22, 2010|publisher=CNN|url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/POLITICS/01/22/obama.ohio/}} |- |{{Flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' |[[Tampa, Florida|Tampa]] |January 28 |President Obama traveled to [[MacDill Air Force Base]] in Tampa, Florida, where he met with crew helping with the [[humanitarian response to the 2010 Haiti earthquake|humanitarian response]] to the [[2010 Haiti earthquake]], before holding a town hall meeting at the [[University of Tampa]].{{Cite news|title=President Obama official schedule and guidance, Jan. 28, 2010. Tampa town hall |work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]] |date=28 January 2010 |accessdate=28 January 2010 |first=Lynn |last=Sweet |url=http://blogs.suntimes.com/sweet/2010/01/president_obama_official_sched_220.html}} |- |{{Flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Baltimore]] |January 29 |President Obama traveled to Baltimore, Maryland. While there, he toured local small businesses, delivered a speech on job tax credits, and met with members of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]].{{Cite news|title=President Obama's Schedule Today |date=29 January 2010 |accessdate=29 January 2010 |publisher=[[CBS News]] |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/blogs/2010/01/29/politics/politicalhotsheet/entry6154134.shtml?tag=contentMain;contentBody}} |} ==February== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flagicon|New Hampshire}} ''[[New Hampshire]]'' |[[Nashua, New Hampshire|Nashua]] |February 2 |President Obama traveled to Nashua, New Hampshire, touring small business before giving a speech at Nashau North High School.{{Cite news|title=Mixeed crowd greets Obama in Nashua |first=Hillary |last=Chabot |date=2 February 2010 |accessdate=2 February 2010 |work=[[Boston Herald]] |url=http://www.bostonherald.com/news/regional/view/20100202mixed_crowd_greets_obama_in_nashua/srvc=home&position=4}} |- |{{Flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Lanham, Maryland|Lanham]] |February 5 |President Obama traveled to Lanham, Maryland, where he toured small businesses and delivered a speech on job creation.{{Cite news|title=Obama's Schedule |publisher=[[CBS News]] |date=5 February 2010 |accessdate=5 February 2010 |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/sections/politics/politicalhotsheet/main503544.shtml?category=Obama%27s+Schedule}}{{Cite news|title=Obama warns job data to fluctuate in coming months |agency=Reuters|first=Jeff |last=Mason |date=January 5, 2010|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-obama-jobs-idUSTRE6144A320100205}} |- |{{Flagicon|Virginia}} ''[[Virginia]]'' |[[Langley, Virginia|Langley]] |February 5 |President Obama traveled to Langley, Virginia, to visit the headquarters of the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] to honor victims of the [[Camp Chapman attack]].{{Cite news|title=Obama honors 7 CIA officers killed in Afghanistan blast |publisher=CNN |date=5 February 2010 |accessdate=5 February 2010 |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2010/POLITICS/02/05/obama.cia.memorial/}} |- |{{Flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Lanham, Maryland|Lanham]] |February 16 |President Obama traveled to Lanham, Maryland, where he discussed the future of [[nuclear power in the United States]] at a local chapter headquarters of the [[International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers]].{{Cite news|title= Obama moves to back nuclear power|date=February 16, 2010|publisher=[[CBC News]] |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/obama-moves-to-back-nuclear-power-1.911173}}{{Cite news|title=Remarks by the President on Energy in Lanham, Michigan |publisher=[[whitehouse.gov]] |date=16 February 2010 |accessdate=16 February 2010 |url=http://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/remarks-president-energy-lanham-maryland}} |- |{{Flagicon|Colorado}} ''[[Colorado]]'' |[[Denver]] |February 18 |President Obama traveled to Denver, Colorado. He delivered remarks at a fundraising rally and a fundraising reception for [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Michael Bennet]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/?pid=87563|title=Remarks at a Fundraiser for Senator Michael F. Bennet in Denver, Colorado|date=February 18, 2010}} |- |{{Flagicon|Nevada}} ''[[Nevada]]'' |[[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]] |February 18–19 |President Obama traveled to Las Vegas, Nevada. He held a town hall meeting with Senate Majority Leader [[Harry Reid]], and then delivered remarks to the Las Vegas Chamber of Commerce and the [[Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/ab5486b6-1d88-11df-a893-00144feab49a.html|title=Obama builds bridges with Las Vegas business|author=Matthew Garrahan|date=19 February 2009|work=Financial Times|publisher=|accessdate=20 February 2010}} |- |{{Flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Bethesda, Maryland|Bethesda]] |February 28 |President Obama traveled to [[Bethesda, Maryland]] for a routine [[general medical examination]] at the [[National Naval Medical Center]] by Dr. Jeffrey Kuhlman and other physicians, who found the president to be "in excellent health." Obama later visited wounded soldiers at the hospital.{{Cite news|authors=Lawrence K. Altman & Jeff Zeleny|title=President in 'Excellent Health,' Routine Checkup Finds|newspaper=New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/01/us/politics/01obama.html|date=March 1, 2010}} |} ==March== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=70|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flagicon|Georgia (U.S. state)}} ''[[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]'' |[[Savannah, Georgia|Savannah]] |March 2 |President Obama traveled to Savannah, Georgia, speaking at the [[Savannah Technical College]] and outlining his energy-efficiency program.{{Cite news|title=Obama Outlines Energy-Efficiency Program |first=Elizabeth |last=Williamson |date=2 March 2010 |accessdate=3 March 2010 |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748703807904575097091911253032?mod=WSJ_WSJ_US_News_5}} |- |{{Flagicon|Virginia}} ''[[Virginia]]'' |[[Arlington, Virginia|Arlington]] |March 5 |President Obama traveled to [[Arlington, Virginia]], discussing his Administration's policy and the economic situation at the headquarters of [[Opower]], a corporation producing [[efficient energy use]] technology.{{Cite news|title= Remarks at Opower in Arlington, Virginia|date=March 5, 2010|url=http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/?pid=87611}} |- |{{Flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]] |[[Glenside, Pennsylvania|Glenside]] |March 8 |President Obama traveled to [[Glenside, Pennsylvania]], where he discussed health care reform at [[Arcadia University]].{{Cite news|title=Obama takes health care message to Philadelphia |first=Scott |last=Wilson |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=8 March 2010 |accessdate=8 March 2010 |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/03/08/AR2010030801703.html?hpid=topnews}} |- |{{Flagicon|Missouri}} ''[[Missouri]]'' |[[St. Louis]] |March 10 |President Obama traveled to [[St. Louis, Missouri]], where he discussed his plans for health care reform.{{Cite news|title=Obama Continues Push for Health Care Reform |first=Daniel |last=Robinson |publisher=[[Voice of America]] |date=10 March 2010 |accessdate=11 March 2010 |url=http://www1.voanews.com/english/news/usa/Obama-Continues-Push-for-Health-Care-Reform-87287492.html}} |- |{{Flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Chevy Chase, Maryland|Chevy Chase]] |March 13 |President Obama traveled to [[Chevy Chase, Maryland]], where he watched his daughter play [[basketball]].{{Cite news|title=President Cheers on Sasha in Chevy Chase |first=Jim |last=Iovino |date=13 March 2010 |accessdate=13 March 2010 |publisher=[[WRC-TV]] |url=http://www.nbcwashington.com/around-town/events/President-Cheers-on-Sasha-in-Chevy-Chase-85690917.html}} |- |{{Flagicon|Georgia (U.S. state)}} ''[[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]'' |[[Atlanta]] |March 13 |President Obama traveled to [[Atlanta]] to discuss his plans for overhaul of the American education system.{{Cite news|title=Obama: Overhaul 'No Child Left Behind' |date=13 March 2010 |accessdate=14 March 2010 |agency=[[Associated Press]] |publisher=[[msnbc.com]] |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/35852205/ns/us_news-education/}} |- |{{Flagicon|Ohio}} ''[[Ohio]]'' |[[Strongsville, Ohio|Strongsville]] |March 15 |President Obama traveled to [[Strongsville, Ohio]], where he discussed plans for health care overhaul.{{Cite news|title=In Ohio, Obama's Health Care Push Is Personal |first=Sheryl |last=Stolberg |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=15 March 2010 |accessdate=15 March 2010 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/16/health/policy/16health.html}} |- |{{Flagicon|Virginia}} |accessdate=23 October 2010 |publisher=''[[Las Vegas Sun]]'' |first=Delen |last=Goldberg}}{{cite news |publisher=[[The Associated Press]] via ''[[Reno Gazette-Journal]]'' |title=Obama praises Reid in Vegas |first=Cristina |last=Silva |date=23 October 2010 |accessdate=23 October 2010 |url=http://www.rgj.com/article/20101023/NEWS19/10230333/1321/news}}.The rally was considered as one of the most successful political rallies in the history of Nevada State politics. |- |{{flagicon|Minnesota}} ''[[Minnesota]]'' |[[Minneapolis]] |October 23 |President Obama traveled to [[Minneapolis]], [[Minnesota]], where he hosted a rally and fundraiser at the [[University of Minnesota]] for [[Mark Dayton]], who was running for [[Minnesota gubernatorial election, 2010|elected]] [[Governor of Minnesota]].{{cite news|author=Brian Bakst|title=Obama rallies Dems at University of Minnesota stop|agency=Associated Press|url=http://www.mprnews.org/story/2010/10/23/obama-campaign|date=October 23, 2010}} |- |{{flagicon|Rhode Island}} ''[[Rhode Island]]'' |[[Woonsocket]], [[Providence, Rhode Island|Providence]] |October 25 |President Obama traveled to [[Woonsocket]], [[Rhode Island]], where he criticized the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] and defended the policies of [[Presidency of Barack Obama|his Administration]]. The President later hosted a fundraiser for the [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee|DCCC]] at the [[Rhode Island Convention Center]] in [[Providence, Rhode Island|Providence]].{{cite news |title=Obama Assails GOP on Clouded Final Campaign Push |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory?id=11966979 |publisher=[[ABC News]] |date=25 October 2010 |accessdate=25 October 2010 |first=David |last=Espo}}{{cite news |title=Obama touts job creation as midterm elections near |publisher=[[Reuters]] |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE69929420101025 |date=25 October 2010 |first=Matt |last=Spetalnick |accessdate=25 October 2010}}{{cite news |url=http://thehill.com/homenews/senate/125779-fighting-obama-tells-dem-candidate-run-scared |publisher=''[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]'' |date=25 October 2010 |accessdate=25 October 2010 |first=Sam |last=Youngman |title='Fighting' Obama tells House Dem candidate to 'run scared'}}{{cite news |url=http://www.boston.com/news/local/rhode_island/articles/2010/10/25/obama_greeted_by_protesters_outside_ri_fundraiser/ |publisher=''[[The Boston Globe]]'' |date=25 October 2010 |accessdate=25 October 2010 |title=Obama greeted by protesters outside RI fundraiser}} |- |{{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Beltsville]] |October 29 |President Obama traveled to [[Beltsville]], [[Maryland]], where he toured a [[sheet metal]] factory, discussing the state of the [[economy]].{{cite news |publisher=[[The Associated Press]] via ''[[The Washington Post]]'' |date=29 October 2010 |accessdate=29 October 2010 |title=Obama says his mission is to accelerate recovery |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/10/29/AR2010102903503.html}} {{Dead link|date=November 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite news |url=http://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-2010-election-ugly-economy-angry-voters-2010-10-29 |publisher=[[MarketWatch]] |date=29 October 2010 |accessdate=29 October 2010 |title=The 2010 election: Ugly economy, angry voters |first=Robert |last=Schroeder}} |- |{{flagicon|Virginia}} ''[[Virginia]]'' |[[Charlottesville]] |October 29 |President Obama traveled to [[Charlottesville]], [[Virginia]], where he campaigned in support of [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] [[Tom Periello]], who is campaigning for [[United States House of Representatives elections in Virginia, 2010|reelection]].{{cite news |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/39922794/ns/politics-decision_2010/ |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |date=30 October 2010 |accessdate=30 October 2010 |first=Darlene |last=Superville |title=Obama appeals for an end to partisan politics — with a jab at GOP}}{{cite news |url=http://www2.timesdispatch.com/news/2010/oct/30/obam30-ar-617392/ |publisher=''[[Richmond Times-Dispatch]]'' |date=30 October 2010 |accessdate=30 October 2010 |first=Olympia |last=Meola |title=Obama rallies for Perriello in Charlottesville |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101031195131/http://www2.timesdispatch.com/news/2010/oct/30/obam30-ar-617392/ |archivedate=31 October 2010 |df= }} |- |{{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Philadelphia]] |October 30 |President Obama traveled to [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]], where he held a rally in support of fellow [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrats]] at [[Temple University]].{{cite news |url=http://www.delcotimes.com/article/DC/20101030/NEWS/31030996 |agency=Associated Press|title=Obama to Philly: 'I need 20,000 doors knocked on' |date=October 30, 2010|first=Joann|last=Loviglio}}{{cite news |title=Obama appears with Onorato and Sestak in Philadelphia |url=http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/10303/1099484-100.stm |publisher=''[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]'' |date=30 October 2010 |accessdate=30 October 2010 |first=Daniel |last=Malloy}} |- |{{flagicon|Connecticut}} ''[[Connecticut]]'' |[[Bridgeport]] |October 30 |President Obama traveled to [[Bridgeport]], [[Connecticut]], where he spoke at a [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] rally at [[Arena at Harbor Yard]].{{cite news |agency=United Press International |date=30 October 2010 |accessdate=31 October 2010 |title= Obama heckled in Connecticut |url= http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2010/10/30/Obama-heckled-in-Connecticut/UPI-43131288454542/}}{{cite news |author= Brittany Lyte |title= Presidential visit draws Bridgeport into Obama legacy |url= http://blog.ctnews.com/connecticutpostings/2010/10/30/presidential-visit-draws-bridgeport-into-obama-legacy/ |publisher= Hearst Communications Inc. |work= CTNews.com}} |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |October 30 |President Obama traveled to [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], where he addressed a rally at the [[Midway Plaisance]] in support of [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] candidates.{{cite news |url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/world/2010/1101/1224282400701.html |publisher=''[[Irish Times]]'' |date=1 November 2010 |accessdate=31 October 2010 |first=Lara |last=Marlowe |title=Obama in final push as losses predicted}}{{cite news |title=Obama in home city Chicago |publisher=''[[Gulf Times]]'' |date=1 November 2010 |accessdate=31 October 2010 |df= }} |- |{{flagicon|Ohio}} ''[[Ohio]]'' |[[Cleveland]] |October 31 |President Obama traveled to [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], where he spoke at a Democratic rally at [[Cleveland State University|Cleveland State University's]] [[Wolstein Center]].{{cite news |title=Obama makes final campaign rounds for Democrats |publisher=''[[Tucson Citizen]]'' |date=31 October 2010 |accessdate=31 October 2010 |first=John |last=Fritze |url=http://tucsoncitizen.com/usa-today-news/2010/10/31/obama-makes-final-campaign-rounds-for-democrats/ }}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite news |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/world/2010-11/01/c_13584822.htm |publisher=[[Xinhua News Agency]] |date=31 October 2010 |accessdate=31 October 2010 |title=U.S. President Obama making final campaign push in Cleveland |first=Yang |last=Lina}} |} ==November== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=95|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{flagicon|India}} [[India]] |[[Mumbai]], [[New Delhi]] |November 6–9 |President Obama traveled to [[Mumbai]], [[India]], as part of a trip to [[Asia]]. The President commemorated the [[2008 Mumbai attacks]], visited the [[Mani Bhavan]] Museum, and hosted various business activities at the [[Oberoi Trident]]. The President later hosted a town hall meeting at [[St. Xavier's College, Mumbai|St Xavier's College]]. During his stay in Mumbai, the President stayed at the [[Taj Mahal Palace & Tower]], which had previously been a terrorist target. The President proceeded to [[New Delhi]], where he visited [[Humayun’s Tomb]] and met with [[Prime Minister of India|Prime Minister]] [[Manmohan Singh]]. He also addressed the joint session of the [[Parliament of India|Indian Parliament]] and participated in a state dinner hosted by Indian's president [[Pratibha Patil]] at the [[Rashtrapati Bhavan]], the official residence of the president of India.{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-fgw-obama-mumbai-20101107,0,459998.story |publisher=''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' |date=6 November 2010 |accessdate=6 November 2010 |title=Obama visits site of Mumbai attacks, praises India's resilience |first=Christi |last=Parsons}}{{cite news |url=http://gulfnews.com/news/world/india/obama-visits-symbols-of-peace-1.707421 |title=Obama visits symbols of peace |first=Pamela |last=Raghunath |date=7 November 2010 |accessdate=6 November 2010 |publisher=''[[Gulf News]]''}}{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/feeds/ap/2010/11/07/general-obama-asia_8082968.html |publisher=[[Forbes]] |date=7 November 2010 |accessdate=7 November 2010 |title=Obama arrives in New Delhi |first=Erica |last=Werner}}{{cite news |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-11-08/delhi/28261983_1_traffic-snarls-traffic-flow-traffic-police |publisher=''[[Times of India]]'' |date=8 November 2010 |accessdate=7 November 2010 |title=Brace for Monday mayhem on roads |first=Rahul |last=Tripathi}}{{cite news |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/indiarealtime/2010/11/07/scenes-from-the-obama-visit-humayun%E2%80%99s-tomb/|title=Scenes from the Obama Visit: Humayun’s Tomb|date=November 7, 2010 |work= Wall Street Journal |accessdate=1 April 2012 |first=Jonathan |last=Weisman}}{{cite news |url=http://www.deccanherald.com/content/110806/obama-visits-humayuns-tomb-floored.html|title=Obama visits Humayun's Tomb; floored by India's history |work= Deccan Herald |accessdate=1 April 2012 }}{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-south-asia-11709097|title=In pictures: US President Barack Obama in India|date=November 8, 2010 |work= BBC News |accessdate=1 April 2012 }}{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-south-asia-11712268|title=Obama confirms US strategic shift towards India|date=November 8, 2010 |publisher= BBC News |accessdate=1 April 2012 |first=Paul |last=Reynolds}}{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-south-asia-11712832|title=US and India put accent on shared values|date=November 8, 2010 |work= BBC News |accessdate=1 April 2012 |first=Sanjoy |last=Majumder}}{{cite news|url=http://articles.cnn.com/2010-11-08/world/india.obama.trip_1_united-states-and-india-michelle-obama-new-delhi?_s=PM:WORLD |title=Obama praises Gandhi in speech to Indian Parliament |date=November 8, 2010 |work=CNN |accessdate=1 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110408211251/http://articles.cnn.com/2010-11-08/world/india.obama.trip_1_united-states-and-india-michelle-obama-new-delhi?_s=PM%3AWORLD |archivedate=8 April 2011 |df= }}{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/09/world/asia/09prexy.html|title=Countering China, Obama Backs India for U.N. Council|date=November 8, 2010 |work= New York Times |accessdate=1 April 2012 |first=Sherly |last=Gay Stolberg|first2=Jim |last2=Yardley }}{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2010/11/08/world/20101109-Obama.html?ref=asia|title=The Obamas in India|date=November 8, 2010 |work= New York Times |accessdate=1 April 2012 |first=Doug |last=Mills }} |- |{{flagicon|Indonesia}} [[Indonesia]] |[[Jakarta]] |November 9–10 |President Obama traveled to [[Jakarta]], [[Indonesia]], as part of a four-country tour of Asia. The President had bilateral meetings with [[President of Indonesia|President]] [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono]] at the [[Istana Negara, Jakarta|Istana Negara]]. Later in the trip, the President visited the [[Istiqlal Mosque, Jakarta]] and delivered a speech at the [[University of Indonesia]] as a follow up to his 2009 [[A New Beginning]] speech.{{cite news |publisher=[[KABC-TV]] |date=9 November 2010 |accessdate=9 November 2010 |title=Obama voices concerns about peace talks |url=http://abclocal.go.com/kabc/story?section=news/world_news&id=7773350}}{{Cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/POLITICS/11/09/obama.perks/ |publisher=[[CNN]] |date=9 November 2010 |accessdate=9 November 2010 |title=Obama: Perks of the job ain't bad |first=Ed |last=Henry}}{{cite news|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2010/11/10/obama-praises-inclusive-islam-indonesia.html |date=10 November 2010 |accessdate=9 November 2010 |publisher=''[[The Jakarta Post]]'' |title=Obama praises inclusive Islam in Indonesia |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101113030004/http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2010/11/10/obama-praises-inclusive-islam-indonesia.html |archivedate=13 November 2010 |df= }}{{cite news |url=http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-world/obama-visits-indonesias-largest-mosque-20101110-17n9v.html |publisher=''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]'' |date=10 November 2010 |accessdate=9 November 2010 |first=Ben |last=Feller |title=Obama visits Indonesia's largest mosque}}{{cite news |title=Obama hails Indonesia as example for world |publisher=[[BBC News]] |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-pacific-11723650 |date=10 November 2010 |accessdate=9 November 2010}}{{cite news |url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/nationworld/2013389502_obama10.html |title=Obama, in Indonesia, criticizes Israel over OK of housing units |publisher=''[[The Seattle Times]]'' |date=9 November 2010 |accessdate=9 November 2010}} |- |{{flagicon|South Korea}} [[South Korea]] |[[Seoul]] |November 10–12 |President Obama traveled to [[Seoul]], [[South Korea]], as part of a four-country tour of Asia. While there, the President attended a [[Veterans Day]] ceremony at the [[Yongsan Garrison]] and had bilateral meetings with [[President of South Korea|President]] [[Lee Myung-bak]] at the [[Blue House]]. The President later attended [[2010 G-20 Seoul summit|G-20 summit meeting]] at the [[COEX Convention & Exhibition Center]].{{cite news |url=http://www.stripes.com/news/pacific/korea/at-yongsan-obama-salutes-u-s-troops-condemns-north-s-nukes-1.125096 |publisher=''[[Stars and Stripes (newspaper)|Stars and Stripes]]'' |date=10 November 2010 |accessdate=12 November 2010 |first=Ashley |last=Rowland |title=At Yongsan, Obama salutes U.S. troops, condemns North's nukes}}{{cite news |url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/40120009/ns/world_news-asiapacific/ |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |first=Ben |last=Feller |title=Obama salutes troops, condemns North Korea |date=10 November 2010 |accessdate=12 November 2010}}{{cite news |url=http://www.kansascity.com/2010/11/10/2419151/obama-consensus-among-g-20-for.html |publisher=''[[Kansas City Star]]'' |title=Obama: Consensus among G-20 for 'balanced' growth |date=10 November 2010 |accessdate=12 November 2010 |first=Jung |last=Yeon-je}}{{cite news|url=http://arabnews.com/economy/article187215.ece |publisher=''[[Arab News]]'' |date=11 November 2010 |accessdate=12 November 2010 |title=G20 must work together to strengthen global economy recovery, Obama says |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101113225536/http://arabnews.com/economy/article187215.ece |archivedate=13 November 2010 |df= }}{{cite news |url=http://www.koreaherald.com/national/Detail.jsp?newsMLId=20101112000945 |publisher=''[[The Korea Herald]]'' |date=12 November 2010 |accessdate=12 November 2010 |title=Obama: G20 more than a talk shop}}{{cite news |url=http://www.businessweek.com/news/2010-11-11/g-20-protesters-brave-thunder-in-peacefully-rally-in-seoul.html |publisher=''[[Bloomberg Businessweek]]'' |date=11 November 2010 |accessdate=12 November 2010 |title=G-20 Protesters Brave Thunder in Peacefully Rally in Seoul |first=Bomi |last=Lim}} |- |{{flagicon|Japan}} [[Japan]] |[[Tokyo]], [[Yokohama]], [[Kamakura, Kanagawa|Kamakura]] |November 12–14 |President Obama traveled after his arrival in [[Tokyo]] to [[Yokohama]], [[Japan]] as part of a four-country tour of Asia. While in Yokohama, the President attended an [[APEC Japan 2010|APEC summit meeting]] with several national leaders held at the InterContinental Yokohama Grand Hotel and [[Pacifico Yokohama|Pacifico Yokohama Conference Center]]. He also held bilateral talks with [[Prime Minister of Japan|Prime Minister]] [[Naoto Kan]] on the sidelines of the summit making joint press announcements. The President visited the famous statue of [[Amida Buddha]] located at the temple of [[Kōtoku-in]] in the city of [[Kamakura, Kanagawa|Kamakura]].{{cite news|url=http://www.sacbee.com/2010/11/13/3183413/obama-affirms-us-commitment-to.html |title=Obama affirms U.S. commitment to defense of Japan |publisher=''[[The Sacramento Bee]]'' |first=Hiromu |last=Namiki |date=13 November 2010 |accessdate=13 November 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-fg-obama-apec-20101114,0,602508.story |publisher=''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' |first=Don |last=Lee |title=Obama makes last Asia-trip pitch for U.S. exports |date=13 November 2010 |accessdate=13 November 2010}} |- |{{flagicon|Portugal}} [[Portugal]] |[[Lisbon]] |November 19–20 |President Obama traveled to [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]] to attend to the [[2010 Lisbon summit|NATO summit meeting]]. Obama met with [[President of Portugal|President]] [[Aníbal Cavaco Silva]] at [[Belém Palace]], and later held bilateral meetings with [[Prime Minister of Portugal|Prime Minister]] [[José Sócrates]]. The President later attended a meeting of the [[North Atlantic Council]], meeting with [[President of Georgia|Georgian President]] [[Mikheil Saakashvili]] on the sidelines.{{Cite news |url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/44/2010/11/energized-obama-pays-respects.html |title=Energized Obama pays respects in Lisbon |publisher=''[[The Washington Post]]'' |date=19 November 2010 |accessdate=19 November 2010 |first=Karen |last=DeYoung}}{{Cite news |url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/83879/20101119/war-exit-missile-shield-key-as-nato-summit-starts.htm |publisher=[[International Business Times]] |date=19 November 2010 |accessdate=19 November 2010 |first=Gerald |last=Helguero |title=War exit, missile shield key as NATO summit starts}}{{cite news|title=At Portugal summit, President Obama will seek to reassure Europe he's not neglecting alliances |url=http://www.canadianbusiness.com/markets/market_news/article.jsp?content=D9JJ7P3G3 |publisher=''[[Canadian Business]]'' |first=Julie |last=Pace |date=19 November 2010 |accessdate=19 November 2010 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite news |title=NATO agrees on missile defence shield, Obama |url=http://www.buenosairesherald.com/BreakingNews/View/51598 |publisher=''[[Buenos Aires Herald]]'' |date=19 November 2010 |accessdate=19 November 2010}}{{cite news |title=Obama meets Saakashvili in Lisbon |url=http://www.politico.com/politico44/perm/1110/u_s_georgia_ties_bce31e1d-220b-4fb2-b418-69505bf6d238.html |publisher=''Politico 44'' |date=19 November 2010 |accessdate=20 November 2010}} |- |{{flagicon|Indiana}} ''[[Indiana]]'' |[[Kokomo, Indiana|Kokomo]] |November 23 |President Obama and Vice President Biden arrived at [[Grissom Air Reserve Base]] before traveling to a [[Chrysler]] transmission plant in [[Kokomo, Indiana|Kokomo]], [[Indiana]]. Obama touts his administration's response to the [[Automotive industry crisis of 2008–2010|automotive crisis]]. Obama and Biden also made surprise visits to the Kokomo Fire Department, Sycamore Elementary School, and Gingerbread House Bakery.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/24/us/politics/24obama.html?_r=1 |publisher=''[[The New York Times]]'' |date=23 November 2010 |accessdate=23 November 2010 |first=Helene |last=Cooper |title=At a 2008 Stop, Obama Promotes His Policies}}{{cite news|title=President Obama's Indiana events while in office|url=http://www.southbendtribune.com/article/20101123/News01/101129655/1130|agency=Associated Press|date=June 1, 2016}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} |} ==December== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flagicon|Afghanistan}} [[Afghanistan]] |[[Bagram]] |December 3 |President Obama made a surprise visit to [[Afghanistan]], where he thanked United States soldiers for their contributions to the [[War in Afghanistan (2001-present)|war]] at [[Bagram Airfield]] outside [[Bagram]], [[Parwan|Parwān Province]].{{cite news |url=http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/ap/top/all/7322857.html |publisher=''[[Houston Chronicle]]'' |title=Obama in Afghanistan: no terror 'safe haven' |first=Ben |last=Feller |date=3 December 2010 |accessdate=3 December 2010}}{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/barackobama/8180167/Barack-Obama-fails-to-meet-President-Karzai-in-Kabul.html |title=Barack Obama fails to meet President Karzai in Kabul |first=Ben |last=Farmer |date=3 December 2010 |accessdate=3 December 2010 |publisher=''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' |location=London}}{{cite news|last=Baker|first=Peter|title=President Obama Lands in Afghanistan for Unannounced Visit|url=http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/12/03/president-obama-lands-in-afghanistan-for-unannounced-visit/|accessdate=5 May 2012|newspaper=The New York Times|date=3 December 2010}}{{cite news|last=Baker|first=Peter|title=Obama Pays Visit to Afghanistan|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/04/us/politics/04prexy.html|accessdate=5 May 2012|newspaper=The New York Times|date=3 December 2010}} |- |{{flagicon|North Carolina}} ''[[North Carolina]]'' |[[Winston-Salem, North Carolina|Winston-Salem]] |December 6 |President Obama traveled to [[Forsyth Technical Community College]] in [[Winston-Salem, North Carolina|Winston-Salem]], [[North Carolina]], calling for increased focus on science and education and saying that the United States faces another "[[Sputnik crisis|Sputnik moment]]".{{cite news |url=http://hken.ibtimes.com/articles/89263/20101206/obama-says-u-s-faces-sputnik-moment-as-tax-deal-nears.htm |title=Obama says U.S. faces 'Sputnik moment' as tax-benefits deal nears |publisher=''[[International Business Times]]'' |date=6 December 2010 |accessdate=15 December 2010 |first=Gerald |last=Helguero |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110713001552/http://hken.ibtimes.com/articles/89263/20101206/obama-says-u-s-faces-sputnik-moment-as-tax-deal-nears.htm |archivedate=13 July 2011 |df= }}{{cite news |url=http://www.kentucky.com/2010/12/06/1555485/obama-emphasizes-technology-in.html |publisher=''[[Lexington Herald-Leader]]'' |title=Obama emphasizes technology in N.C. visit |first=Rob page.title: List of presidential trips made by Barack Obama during 2015

revision.text:
{{main|Presidency of Barack Obama}} [[File:Barack Obama tours Kenai Fjords, Alaska 9.1.15.jpg|thumb|President Obama tours the [[Kenai Fjords National Park]] during his visit to [[Alaska]], September 1, 2015]] This is a '''list of presidential trips made by [[Barack Obama]] during 2015''', the seventh year of [[Presidency of Barack Obama|his presidency]] as the [[List of Presidents of the United States|44th]] [[President of the United States]]. This list excludes trips made within [[Washington, D.C.]], the U.S. federal capital in which the [[White House]], the official residence and principal workplace of the President, is located. Additionally excluded are trips to [[Camp David]], the country residence of the President, and to the private home of the [[Family of Barack Obama|Obama family]] in [[Kenwood, Chicago]], [[Illinois]]. ==January== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/

[[San Francisco]] |June 18–20 |In the [[Greater Los Angeles Area]], President Obama attended two fundraising events for the Democratic National Committee, before attending a round table discussion at the residence of television producer and writer [[Chuck Lorre]] in [[Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles|Pacific Palisades]] and a dinner at the residence of actor and director [[Tyler Perry]] in [[Beverly Hills, California|Beverly Hills]].{{cite news|title=Obama, Clinton Coming To Town For Separate West LA-Area Fundraisers|url=http://losangeles.cbslocal.com/2015/06/16/obama-clinton-coming-to-southern-california-for-separate-west-la-area-fundraisers/|accessdate=June 17, 2015|publisher=[[KCBS-TV]]|date=June 16, 2015}} He also met with comedian [[Marc Maron]] at his residence in [[Highland Park, Los Angeles|Highland Park]], where he taped his appearance for Maron's podcast, ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]''.{{cite news|last1=Moreno|first1=John A.|last2=Mester|first2=Mark|last3=Pamer|first3=Melissa|last4=Knight|first4=Nerissa|title=Day 2 of Obama Visit: President’s Schedule Included Podcast Interview at Highland Park Home|url=http://ktla.com/2015/06/19/day-2-of-obama-visit-presidents-schedule-includes-podcast-interview-at-highland-park-home/|accessdate=June 21, 2015|publisher=[[KTLA]]|date=June 19, 2015}} In the [[San Francisco Bay Area]], President Obama attended the annual meeting of the [[United States Conference of Mayors]]. He also attended fundraising events for the Democratic National Committee and the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee.{{cite news|last1=Richman|first1=Josh|title=President Obama, Hillary Clinton to visit Bay Area next week|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/politics-government/ci_28301733/president-obama-hillary-clinton-visit-bay-area-next|accessdate=June 13, 2015|publisher=''[[San Jose Mercury News]]''|date=June 12, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|South Carolina}} ''[[South Carolina]]'' |[[Charleston, South Carolina|Charleston]] |June 26 |President Obama, along with [[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] [[Michelle Obama]], Vice President Joe Biden, former Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]], and [[Speaker of the United States House of Representatives|House Speaker]] [[John Boehner]], attended the funeral for [[South Carolina Senate|South Carolina Senator]] [[Clementa C. Pinckney]], who was among those killed at the [[Charleston church shooting]]. The President also delivered a eulogy for Pinckney.{{cite news|author1=[[Jeremy Diamond (journalist)|Jeremy Diamond]]|author2=[[Michelle Kosinski]]|title=Obama heading to Charleston to deliver eulogy, Boehner leads bipartisan delegation|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/06/22/politics/president-barack-obama-charleston-eulogy/|accessdate=26 June 2015|publisher=[[CNN]]|date=June 25, 2015}} |} ==July== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Tennessee}} ''[[Tennessee]]'' |[[Madison, Tennessee|Madison]],
[[Nashville]] |July 1 |President Obama delivered a speech on health care at Taylor Stratton Elementary School.{{cite news|author1=Emily Kubis|title=Obama talks health care in Madison|url=https://www.nashvillepost.com/news/2015/7/1/obama_talks_health_care_in_madison|accessdate=2 July 2015|publisher=[[Nashville Post]]|date=July 1, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' |[[La Crosse, Wisconsin|La Crosse]] |July 2 |President Obama delivered a speech on the economy at [[University of Wisconsin–La Crosse]].{{cite news|author1=Bill Glauber|title=Obama pushes economic agenda in La Crosse, chides Republicans|url=http://www.jsonline.com/news/statepolitics/drama-expected-as-obama-visits-la-crosse-and-greeted-by-scott-walker-b99531109z1-311464001.html|accessdate=3 July 2015|publisher=[[Milwaukee Journal Sentinel]]|date=July 2, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Philadelphia]] |July 14 |President Obama delivered remarks on [[criminal justice reform]]s at the 106th [[National Association for the Advancement of Colored People|NAACP]] Convention.{{cite news|last1=Rhodan|first1=Maya|title=Obama Calls for Sweeping Criminal Justice Reforms in NAACP Speech|url=http://time.com/3958093/barack-obama-criminal-justice-reforms-naacp/|accessdate=July 14, 2015|publisher=''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''|date=July 14, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Oklahoma}} ''[[Oklahoma]]'' |[[Durant, Oklahoma|Durant]],
[[El Reno, Oklahoma|El Reno]] |July 15–16 |In Durant, President Obama delivered remarks on the economy at the headquarters of the [[Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma|Choctaw Nation]]. In El Reno, President Obama visited the [[Federal Correctional Institution, El Reno|Federal Correctional Institution]], becoming the first sitting U.S. President to visit a [[federal prison]].{{cite news|last1=Casteel|first1=Chris|title=President Obama heading to Oklahoma next week|url=http://newsok.com/president-obama-heading-to-oklahoma-next-week/article/5432912|accessdate=July 11, 2015|publisher=''[[The Oklahoman]]''|date=July 10, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Eilperin|first1=Juliet|last2=Horwitz|first2=Sari|title=Obama to visit federal prison in Oklahoma on Thursday|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/post-politics/wp/2015/07/10/obama-to-visit-federal-prison-in-oklahoma-on-thursday/|accessdate=July 11, 2015|publisher=''[[The Washington Post]]''|date=July 10, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |July 17–18 |President Obama attended a [[Democratic National Committee]] fundraiser.{{cite news|last1=Jordan|first1=Fabian|title=Obama taking weekend trip to New York City|url=http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/248286-obama-taking-weekend-trip-to-new-york-city|accessdate=July 18, 2015|publisher=''[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]''|date=July 16, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Pittsburgh]] |July 21 |President Obama addressed the 116th Veterans of Foreign Wars National Convention, in light of the [[2015 Chattanooga shootings]].{{cite news|last1=Holmes|first1=Kristen|last2=Diaz|first2=Daniella|title=Obama addresses Chattanooga shootings in speech to veterans|url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/07/21/politics/obama-vfw-speech-pittburgh-veterans-of-foreign-wars-national-convention/|accessdate=July 21, 2015|publisher=[[CNN]]|date=July 21, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |July 21 |President Obama taped his third and final appearance on ''[[The Daily Show]]''. He also attended a [[Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee]] fundraiser.{{cite news|title=President Obama heading back to NYC for 'Daily Show' taping with Jon Stewart|url=http://7online.com/politics/president-obama-back-in-nyc-today-for-daily-show-taping/868818/|accessdate=July 21, 2015|publisher=[[WABC-TV]]|date=July 21, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|KEN}} [[Kenya]] |[[Nairobi]] |July 24–26 |On July 24–26, 2015, President Obama traveled to Kenya for a three-day state visit, becoming the first sitting U.S. president to visit the country. His father, [[Barack Obama, Sr.]], was a native of the Kenyan village [[Nyang'oma Kogelo]].{{cite news|last1=Honan|first1=Edith|title=Kenya to welcome Obama 'home' to a continent that feels ignored|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-kenya-usa-obama-idUSKCN0PU11120150720|accessdate=February 19, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=July 20, 2015}} President Obama arrived at the [[Jomo Kenyatta International Airport]] in the Kenyan capital [[Nairobi]] on the evening of Friday, July 24, where he was welcomed in the tarmac by [[President of Kenya|Kenyan President]] [[Uhuru Kenyatta]] and his half-sister [[Family of Barack Obama#Auma Obama|Auma]].{{cite news|title=Obama lands in Kenya to euphoric welcome|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/07/obama-arrives-kenya-tight-security-150724163810652.html|accessdate=February 19, 2015|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=July 25, 2015}} After arriving, Obama dined with other members of his [[Family of Barack Obama#Paternal relations|paternal family]] at a restaurant in his hotel.{{cite news|last1=Dovere|first1=Edward-Isaac|title=Obama meets with extended family on first night in Nairobi|url=http://www.politico.com/story/2015/07/barack-obama-family-dinner-trip-nairobi-kenya-120591.html|accessdate=July 25, 2015|publisher=[[Politico]]|date=July 24, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Mason|first1=Jeff|title=Obama dines with Kenyan family after arriving in father's homeland|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/obama-africa-kenya-idINKCN0PY25I20150724|accessdate=February 19, 2016|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=July 25, 2015}} On Saturday, July 25, President Obama delivered remarks at the [https://web.archive.org/web/20160219221854/http://ges2015kenya.org/ 2015 Global Entrepreneurship Summit] held at the [[United Nations Office at Nairobi]], where he urged African entrepreneurs to promote security and development while working towards economic growth in the African continent.{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=David|last2=Mutiga|first2=Murithi|title=Obama's message of hope rings true in call for Africa to flourish|url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/jul/25/barack-obama-message-hope-kenya-africa-speech|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=July 25, 2015}} He also visited an innovation fair organized to promote his "Power Africa" initiative of promoting [[electric power]] and [[renewable energy]] in the Sub-Saharan Africa.{{cite web|title=Remarks by the President During Visit to Power Africa Innovation Fair|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/07/25/remarks-president-during-visit-power-africa-innovation-fair|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=February 19, 2016|date=July 25, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Power Africa initiative on course, says Barack Obama|url=http://www.nation.co.ke/news/Power-Africa-project-is-just-a-matter-of-time-Barack-Obama/-/1056/2808200/-/sljq3cz/-/index.html|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[Daily Nation]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=[[Nation Media Group]]|date=July 25, 2015}} Later that day, President Obama laid a wreath and paid his respects at a memorial honoring the victims of the [[1998 United States embassy bombings|1998 U.S. embassy bombings]].{{cite news|title=Barack Obama visits the US Embassy bombing memorial in Nairobi|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/barackobama/11762770/Barack-Obama-visits-the-US-Embassy-bombing-memorial-in-Nairobi.html|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=July 25, 2015}} Obama then headed to the [[State House (Kenya)|State House]] for an official welcoming ceremony and a bilateral meeting with President Kenyatta, where the two presidents mainly discussed [[counter-terrorism]] with regards to dealing with [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]].{{cite news|title=Obama Meets with Kenyatta|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/obama-meets-with-kenyatta/2878139.html|accessdate=July 25, 2015|publisher=[[Voice of America]]|date=July 25, 2015}} In the evening, the President was hosted a state dinner by President Kenyatta.{{cite news|last1=Flores|first1=Reena|title=Obama shows off dance moves at Kenya state dinner|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/obama-shows-off-dance-moves-at-kenya-state-dinner/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[CBS News]]|date=July 26, 2015}} On Sunday, July 26, President Obama delivered a speech addressing the Kenyan people at the [[Moi International Sports Centre|Safaricom Indoor Arena]]. In his speech, he urged Kenyans to eradicate [[Corruption in Kenya|corruption]], confront [[Terrorism in Kenya|terrorism]], and combat inequality, saying: "You can choose the path to progress, but it requires making some important choices... it means continuing down the path of a strong, more inclusive, more accountable and transparent democracy" to "help you extend opportunity, and educate youth, and face down threats, and embrace reconciliation."{{cite news|last1=Superville|first1=Darlene|title=Obama Closes Out Historic Visit To Kenya|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/obama-closes-out-historic-visit-to-kenya_us_55b4c834e4b0224d883281fb|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=July 26, 2015}}{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama to the Kenyan People|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/07/26/remarks-president-obama-kenyan-people|publisher=[[White House Office of the Press Secretary]]|accessdate=February 19, 2016|date=July 26, 2015}} Before departing Kenya, Obama met with civil society groups at [[Kenyatta University]] and toured the [[Nairobi National Park]].{{cite news|last1=Roberts|first1=Alex|title=President Obama Gives Talk At Kenyatta University!|url=http://tuko.co.ke/24236-live-updates-president-obama-make-appearance-kenyatta-university.html|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=Tuko.co.ke|date=July 26, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Obama-mania hits Kenya with US President’s ‘home coming’|url=http://citizen.co.za/429931/obama-mania-hits-kenya-with-us-presidents-home-coming/|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[The Citizen (South Africa)|The Citizen]]|agency=[[African News Agency]]|date=July 22, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|ETH}} [[Ethiopia]] |[[Addis Ababa]] |July 26–28 |President Obama became the first sitting U.S. president to travel to Ethiopia. On July 27, President Obama met with [[Prime Minister of Ethiopia|Ethiopian prime minister]] [[Hailemariam Desalegn]] at the [[National Palace (Ethiopia)|National Palace]]; talks focused on the Somali Islamist militant group [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] and other security threats, as well as on [[human rights in Ethiopia]]. Obama also held talks with Kenyan and Ugandan leaders, discussing the [[South Sudanese Civil War|South Sudan crisis]].Davis Smith and Reuters, [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jul/27/barack-obama-first-visit-ethiopia-serving-us-president Barack Obama makes first visit to Ethiopia by serving US president], ''The Guardian'' (July 27, 2015). The following day, Obama visited the [[African Union]] headquarters (Mandela Hall) and delivered remarks there, calling upon African leaders to respect democracy and uphold human rights.[https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/07/28/remarks-president-obama-people-africa Remarks by President Obama to the People of Africa], [[White House Office of the Press Secretary]] (July 28, 2015). |} ==August and September== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Nevada}} ''[[Nevada]]'' |[[Las Vegas]] |August 24 |President Obama attended the National Clean Energy Summit.{{cite news|author1=Kristin Donnelly|title=President Obama Rolls the Dice in Las Vegas on Climate Change|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/president-obama-rolls-dice-las-vegas-climate-change-n414956|accessdate=24 August 2015|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=August 24, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Louisiana}} ''[[Louisiana]]'' |[[New Orleans]] |August 27 |President Obama attended the decennial commemoration of [[Hurricane Katrina]], where he met with recovering residents and delivered remarks at a community centre at the [[Lower Ninth Ward]].{{cite news|last1=Superville|first1=Darlene|title=Obama says New Orleans is 'moving forward' after hurricane|url=http://www.kansascity.com/news/government-politics/article32513097.html|accessdate=August 27, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Kansas City Star]]''|date=August 27, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Alaska}} ''[[Alaska]]'' |[[Anchorage]],
[[Dillingham, Alaska|Dillingham]],
[[Kotzebue, Alaska|Kotzebue]],
[[Seward, Alaska|Seward]] |August 31 – September 3 |{{see also|Global warming in the Arctic}} President Obama traveled to Anchorage and attended the GLACIER conference, regarding the effects of [[climate change]] in the [[Arctic]].{{cite news|last1=Cama|first1=Timothy|title=Obama to highlight climate change impacts in Alaska visit|url=http://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/251040-obama-to-highlight-climate-change-impacts-in-alaska|accessdate=August 17, 2015|publisher=''[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]''|date=August 13, 2015}} President Obama also visited the towns of Dillingham, Kotzebue and Seward.{{cite news|last1=Demer|first1=Lisa|title=FAA announces flight restrictions for Seward, Kotzebue, Dillingham during Obama visit|url=https://www.adn.com/article/20150829/faa-announces-flight-restrictions-seward-kotzebue-dillingham-during-obama-visit|accessdate=August 30, 2015|publisher=''[[Alaska Dispatch News]]''|date=August 29, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Massachusetts}} ''[[Massachusetts]]'' |[[Boston]] |September 7 |President Obama delivered a [[Labor Day]] breakfast address to the Greater Boston Labor Council at the [[Boston Park Plaza Hotel & Towers]]. The president paid tribute to Boston, the labor movement, and U.S. workers.[https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/09/08/remarks-president-greater-boston-labor-council-labor-day-breakfast Remarks by the President at Greater Boston Labor Council Labor Day Breakfast], [[White House Office of the Press Secretary]] (September 8, 2016).Stephanie Ebbert, [https://www.bostonglobe.com/metro/2015/09/07/labor-day-visit-obama-praises-boston-workers/xm4YFB6ZIqgiCfYLIDjMKN/story.html], ''Boston Globe'' (September 8, 2015). Before departing Boston, Obama made an unscheduled stop at the historic [[Union Oyster House]], meeting customers there. Aboard Air Force One, Obama met with Massachusetts' U.S. senators, [[Elizabeth Warren]] and [[Edward J. Markey]], along with Massachusetts U.S. Representatives [[Katherine Clark]] and [[Seth Moulton]], and New Hampshire U.S. Representative [[Ann McLane Kuster]]. |- |{{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' |[[Warren, Michigan|Warren]] |September 9 |President Obama delivered a speech on free community colleges at the Michigan Technical Education Center. He was accompanied by [[Second Lady of the United States|Second Lady]] [[Jill Biden]].{{cite news|author1=David Jackson|title=Obama's day: A college trip to Michigan|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/theoval/2015/09/09/obama-jill-biden-warren-free-community-college-michigan-technical-education-center/71920736/|accessdate=September 10, 2015|publisher=[[USA Today]]|date=September 9, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Iowa}} ''[[Iowa]]'' |[[Des Moines, Iowa|Des Moines]] |September 14 |President Obama visited the [[North High School (Des Moines)|North High School]] with [[United States Secretary of Education|Secretary of Education]] [[Arne Duncan]] to participate in a town hall meeting, discussing college accessibility and affordability.{{cite news|last1=Bolten|first1=Kathy A.|last2=Rodgers|first2=Grant|title=In Des Moines, President Obama touts college access|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/education/2015/09/14/president-obama-north-high-school/72265012/|accessdate=October 6, 2015|work=[[The Des Moines Register]]|date=September 15, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |September 27–29 |President Obama addressed the [[Sustainable Development Goals|UN Sustainable Development Summit]] and the [[Seventieth session of the United Nations General Assembly|seventieth session]] of the [[United Nations General Assembly]]. He also met with [[Russia]]n [[President of Russia|President]] [[Vladimir Putin]].{{cite news|title=President Obama makes forceful defense on New Development Goals during UN General Assembly|url=http://abc7ny.com/politics/president-obama-to-begin-3-day-visit-to-nyc-on-sunday/1004077/|accessdate=September 28, 2015|work=[[WABC-TV]]|publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company]]|date=September 28, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Obama in New York for U.N., Putin talks|url=http://www.timesunion.com/news/article/Obama-in-New-York-for-U-N-Putin-talks-6533843.php|accessdate=September 28, 2015|work=[[Times Union (Albany)|Times Union]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=September 27, 2015}} |} ==October== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Oregon}} ''[[Oregon]]'' |[[Roseburg, Oregon|Roseburg]] |October 9 |President Obama met privately with the survivors and the families of the victims of the [[Umpqua Community College shooting]].{{cite news|last1=Holmes|first1=Kristen|title=Obama in Oregon: 'Strong feelings' about preventing next shooting|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/10/09/politics/obama-oregon-shooting-visit/|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[CNN]]|publisher=[[Time Warner]]|date=October 10, 2015}} During his visit, local [[Right to keep and bear arms in the United States|gun rights]] activists protested against further [[gun control]] laws.{{cite news|title=Protests as President Obama visits college shooting families|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-34492600|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=[[BBC|British Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=October 10, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[San Francisco]],
[[Los Angeles]],
[[San Diego]] |October 9–11 |President Obama first arrived in San Francisco, where he attended a private round table discussion with members of the [[Democratic National Committee]] and a fundraiser at [[The Warfield]].{{cite news|last1=Edevane|first1=Gillian|title=President Obama Arrives in Bay Area After Contentious Oregon Visit|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/President-Obama-Arrives-in-Bay-Area-After-Contentious-Visit-in-Oregon--331754941.html|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[KNTV]]|publisher=[[NBC]]|date=October 9, 2015}} The President then headed to Los Angeles to attend three fundraisers – one at the residence of director and producer [[J. J. Abrams]], another at a private performance given by [[Jamie Foxx]] in [[Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles|Pacific Palisades]], and the last hosted by interior designer [[Michael S. Smith (interior designer)|Michael S. Smith]] and [[United States Ambassador to Spain|U.S. Ambassador to Spain]] [[James Costos]].{{cite news|last1=Bellantoni|first1=Christina|title=President Obama arrives in Los Angeles for fundraising visit|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-your-guide-to-surviving-obamajam-other-saturday-traffic-nightmares-20151010-story.html|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=October 10, 2015}} President Obama spent the remainder of his weekend in [[Rancho Santa Fe, California|Rancho Santa Fe]].{{cite news|title=Obama lands in San Diego for weekend|url=http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/news/2015/oct/10/president-obama-rancho-santa-fe/|accessdate=October 11, 2015|work=[[San Diego Union-Tribune]]|date=October 10, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|West Virginia}} ''[[West Virginia]]'' |[[Charleston, West Virginia|Charleston]] |October 21 |President Obama attended a community discussion regarding the issue of [[substance abuse]], meeting with teachers, medical professionals, and members of law enforcement, among others.{{cite news|title=Obama to visit Charleston Wednesday|url=http://www.register-herald.com/news/obama-to-visit-charleston-wednesday/article_94282d58-bf9d-5c85-b421-0b8df16e37b9.html|accessdate=October 17, 2015|publisher=[[The Register-Herald]]|date=October 16, 2015}} West Virginia has the highest rate of [[drug overdose]]-related deaths in the United States.{{cite news|last1=Edwards|first1=Julia|title=Obama targets nation's heroin problem in West Virginia trip|url=https://news.yahoo.com/obama-target-nations-heroin-problem-west-virginia-trip-160738570.html|accessdate=October 23, 2015|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|publisher=[[Yahoo!]]|date=October 21, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |October 27–28 |President Obama attended the [[International Association of Chiefs of Police]] (IACP) conference at [[McCormick Place]], addressing the issue of gun violence, gun control legislation, as well as [[criminal justice reform]].{{cite news|title=Obama to address police chiefs in Chicago today|url=http://wgntv.com/2015/10/27/obama-to-address-police-chiefs-in-chicago-today/|accessdate=October 27, 2015|publisher=[[WGN-TV]]|date=October 27, 2015}} Obama spoke at the IACP conference, attended two political fund raisers, and watched the [[Chicago Bulls]] play the [[Cleveland Cavaliers]] at the [[United Center]].{{cite news|title=Obama tries to walk tightrope on policing in Chicago speech|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/local/breaking/ct-barack-obama-chicago-visit-met-20151027-story.html|accessdate=October 28, 2015|publisher=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=October 27, 2015}} |} ==November and December== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|New Jersey}} ''[[New Jersey]]''
{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[Newark, New Jersey|Newark]],
[[New York City]] |November 2 |President Obama traveled to New Jersey to address [[criminal justice reform]], where he held a round table discussion and gave a speech at [[Rutgers University-Newark|Rutgers University campus in Newark]].{{cite news|title=How Rutgers-Newark landed a (last-minute) visit from President Obama |url= http://www.nj.com/education/2015/11/obama_in_newark_how_rutgers_landed_a_last-minute_p.html |accessdate=November 6, 2015 |work=[[NJ.com]] |date=November 1, 2015}} He was accompanied during part of the trip by US Senator [[Cory Booker]], and Newark Mayor [[Ras Baraka]].{{cite news|title=Obama To Visit Newark To Speak On Criminal Justice Reform|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2015/10/27/obama-to-visit-newark-to-speak-on-criminal-justice-reform/|accessdate=October 28, 2015|work=[[CBS Local Media]]|publisher=[[CBS News]]|date=October 27, 2015}} Obama made a visit to Integrity House, a [[halfway house]] in Newark, meeting with ex-offenders in the home who are undergoing [[substance abuse]] rehabilitation and job training.{{cite news|title=Obama to visit New Jersey today|url=http://www.app.com/story/news/politics/2015/10/31/obama-visit-new-jersey-monday/74948132/|accessdate=November 3, 2015|work=[[Asbury Park Press]]|publisher=app.com|date=November 2, 2015}} President Obama also traveled to New York City, to attend fundraisers for the [[Democratic National Committee]] and the [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee]].{{cite news|title=5 things you need to know about Obama's trip to Newark|url=http://www.nj.com/politics/index.ssf/2015/11/5_things_to_know_about_obamas_trip_to_newark.html|accessdate=November 2, 2015|work=[[NJ.com]]|publisher=NJ.com|date=November 2, 2015}} While in [[Manhattan]], Obama attended a showing of the [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] musical ''[[Hamilton (musical)|Hamilton]]''.{{cite news |title=Obama rips into 2016 GOP field, mocks their debate complaints |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/11/02/politics/obama-republicans-cnbc/index.html |accessdate=November 3, 2015|work=[[CNN]] |publisher=CNN |date=November 2, 2015}} Obama then returned to New Jersey before traveling back to the [[White House]]. |- |{{flagicon|TUR}} [[Turkey]] |[[Antalya]] |November 14–17 |President Obama attended the [[2015 G-20 Antalya summit|G-20 summit meeting]] in [[Antalya]], where topics such as [[investment strategy]], [[climate change]], [[financial regulation]], [[Political corruption#Opposing corruption|anti-corruption]], and issues on trade and energy were discussed in an effort to strengthen the [[global economy]] and cooperation.{{cite news|last1=Boyer|first1=Dave|title=Obama to visit Turkey, Philippines, Malaysia in November|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/oct/26/obama-visit-turkey-philippines-malaysia-november/|accessdate=October 27, 2015|work=[[The Washington Times]]|date=October 26, 2015}} According to [[National Security Advisor (United States)|National Security Advisor]] [[Susan Rice]], President Obama also discussed "[[Computer security|cybersecurity]], [[refugee]]s, [[global health]] security, and [[counter-terrorism]]" during the summit.{{cite news|title=Abe to tout economic measures at G-20 talks|url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2015/11/13/business/abe-tout-economic-measures-g-20-talks/#.VkdYl98rLeQ|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[The Japan Times]]|agency=[[Kyodo News]]|date=November 13, 2015}} He also met with [[President of Turkey|Turkish President]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] (to discuss efforts in managing the [[Syria–Turkey border]], amidst the [[Refugees of the Syrian Civil War|Syrian Civil War refugee crisis]]) and [[Salman of Saudi Arabia|King Salman]] of Saudi Arabia.{{cite news|title=Obama to meet with leaders of Turkey, Canada: White House|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/12/us-g20-turkey-obama-idUSKCN0T129J20151112#WbL7hdyWp6Ie7rt6.97|accessdate=November 14, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 12, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Obama to meet Saudi King Salman at G20-summit in Turkey: White House official|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/991867/obama-in-turkey-for-summit-overshadowed-by-paris-attacks/|accessdate=November 15, 2015|work=[[The Express Tribune]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 15, 2015}}{{cite news|author1=[[Lynn Sweet|Sweet, Lynn]]|title=Obama guidance, press schedule Nov. 14, 15, 2015. To Turkey for G20|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/7/71/1100896/obama-guidance-press-schedule-nov-14-15-2015-turkey-g20|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|date=November 14, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151114210939/http://chicago.suntimes.com/news/7/71/1100896/obama-guidance-press-schedule-nov-14-15-2015-turkey-g20|archivedate=November 14, 2015|df=}} Additionally, President Obama met with [[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] in a 30-minute meeting to discuss efforts in tackling the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] and other terrorist groups and resolving the [[Syrian Civil War]], amidst disagreements with the United States regarding [[Russian military intervention in the Syrian Civil War|Russia's military intervention]].{{cite news|author1=[[Peter Baker (author)|Baker, Peter]]|author2=Shear, Michael D.|title=Supporting France, Obama Loath to Add Troops to ISIS Fight|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/16/world/europe/obama-g20-turkey.html|accessdate=November 16, 2015|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=November 15, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Hope|first1=Christopher|title=David Cameron and Barack Obama use G20 summit to urge Vladimir Putin to back them over Isil|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/islamic-state/11997551/Cameron-and-Obama-urge-Putin-to-back-them-over-Isil.html|accessdate=November 16, 2015|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=November 16, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|PHI}} [[Philippines]] |[[Manila]],
[[Pasay]] |November 17–20 |President Obama attended the [[APEC Philippines 2015|APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting]] in [[Manila]], focusing on [[inclusive growth]]. On the sidelines of the summit in Manila, he held bilateral meetings with [[President of the Philippines|Philippine President]] [[Benigno Aquino III]], [[Prime Minister of Japan|Japanese Prime Minister]] [[Shinzō Abe]] and newly elected prime ministers [[Malcolm Turnbull]] of Australia and [[Justin Trudeau]] of Canada,{{cite news|title=Obama, Abe to meet in Philippines on Nov. 19 on APEC fringes|url=http://asia.nikkei.com/Politics-Economy/International-Relations/Obama-Abe-to-meet-in-Philippines-on-Nov.-19-on-APEC-fringes|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[The Nikkei]]|date=November 13, 2015}}{{cite news|title=Obama to meet Turnbull in Manila|url=http://www.businessspectator.com.au/news/2015/11/13/international-news/obama-meet-turnbull-manila|accessdate=November 14, 2015|work=[[Business Spectator]]|publisher=[[News Corp Australia]]|date=November 13, 2015}} as well as meetings with [[Trans-Pacific Partnership]] and [[Pacific Alliance]] leaders.{{cite news|last1=Young|first1=Audrey|title=APEC summit: Obama backs Trans Pacific Partnership|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=11547492|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The New Zealand Herald]]|date=November 19, 2015}} President Obama also delivered remarks at a [[Philippine Navy]] coastal facility by [[Manila Bay]], where he also toured the [[BRP Gregorio del Pilar (PF-15)|BRP ''Gregorio del Pilar'' (PF-15)]], to highlight the United States' commitment to assist in maritime security in the region, amidst the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]].{{cite news|title=Sea rows ‘central issue’ in Obama Asia visit |url=http://www.manilatimes.net/breaking_news/sea-rows-central-issue-in-obama-asia-visit/ |accessdate=November 14, 2015 |work=[[The Manila Times]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=November 13, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151116130500/http://www.manilatimes.net/breaking_news/sea-rows-central-issue-in-obama-asia-visit/ |archivedate=November 16, 2015 |df= }} During his speech in front of the Philippine Navy, President Obama announced that the [[Federal government of the United States|U.S. government]] will donate the [[research vessel]] [[RV Melville|RV ''Melville'']] and two [[Hamilton-class cutter|''Hamilton''-class cutters]] to the Philippine Navy, one of which will be the [[USCGC Boutwell (WHEC-719)|USCGC ''Boutwell'' (WHEC-719)]].{{cite news|title=PH to get 3rd Hamilton-class warship from US|url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/113195-philippine-navy-get-boutwell-cutter|accessdate=November 18, 2015|work=[[Rappler]]|date=November 18, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Gagalac|first1=Ron|title=Obama: US to give 2 more ships to PH|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/11/17/15/obama-us-to-give-2-more-ships-to-ph|accessdate=November 17, 2015|work=[[ABS-CBNnews.com]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=November 17, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Cahiles|first1=Gerg|title=Obama: U.S. to transfer two vessels to Philippine Navy|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/news/2015/11/17/Obama-U.S.-to-transfer-two-vessels-to-PH-navy.html|accessdate=November 17, 2015|work=[[CNN Philippines]]|date=November 17, 2015}} He later participated at the [[APEC Philippines 2015#CEO Summit|APEC 2015 CEO Summit]], where he met with [[Alibaba Group|Alibaba]] founder and executive chairman [[Jack Ma]] and [[SALt lamp]] inventor Aisa Mijeno and urged business executives to combat [[climate change]].{{cite news|author1=[[Alvin Elchico|Elchico, Alvin]]|title=White House invited Pinay scientist to APEC CEO Summit|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/11/19/15/white-house-invited-pinay-scientist-to-apec-ceo-summit|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[ABS-CBNnews.com]]|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]|date=November 20, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Nelson|first1=Colleen McCain|title=Obama Urges CEOs to Fight Climate Change at APEC Summit|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/obama-urges-ceos-to-fight-climate-change-at-apec-summit-1447821870|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|date=November 17, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|MAS}} [[Malaysia]] |[[Kuala Lumpur]] |November 20–22 |President Obama attended the [[Tenth East Asia Summit]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]], which focused on [[Military intervention against ISIL|military intervention]] against the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] and the [[Territorial disputes in the South China Sea|territorial disputes]] in the [[South China Sea]].{{cite news|last1=Menon|first1=Praveen|last2=Spetalnick|first2=Matt|title=Obama says summit to focus on Islamic State militancy|url=https://news.yahoo.com/security-tightened-malaysia-ahead-obama-arrival-summit-022230391.html|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 20, 2015}} On the sidelines of the summit in Kuala Lumpur, the President met with refugees, many of which were [[2015 Rohingya refugee crisis|Rohingya refugees]], at the [http://www.dignityforchildren.org/ Dignity for Children Foundation] refugee center to urge the acceptance of [[Refugees of the Syrian Civil War|Syrian refugees]] into the United States,{{cite news|last1=Memoli|first1=Michael A.|title=At refugee center in Malaysia, Obama calls on U.S. to welcome the 'forgotten'|url=http://www.latimes.com/world/asia/la-fg-obama-malaysia-refugee-center-20151121-story.html|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=November 21, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Spetalnick|first1=Matt|title=Obama visits refugees in Malaysia to highlight global crisis|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/21/us-obama-refugees-idUSKCN0TA09Q20151121#lM0oDxoAAzmEa1LW.97|accessdate=November 22, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 21, 2015}}{{cite news|title=US President Obama draws attention to Rohingya refugees in Malaysia|url=http://www.dailysabah.com/americas/2015/11/21/us-president-obama-draws-attention-to-rohingya-refugees-in-malaysia|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[Daily Sabah]]|agency=[[Deutsche Presse-Agentur]]|date=November 21, 2015}} participated in the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative (YSEALI) town hall at [[Taylor's University]] where he urged the Southeast Asian youth to fight against discrimination,{{cite news|last1=Au|first1=Eunice|title=Obama holds dialogue with Asean youth|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/asia/se-asia/obama-holds-dialogue-with-asean-youth|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The Straits Times]]|date=November 21, 2015}} and met with Malaysian [[civil society]] groups at a round table meeting at the [[Ritz-Carlton Kuala Lumpur]].{{cite news|title=Obama meets Malaysian civil society groups|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2015/11/21/Obama-meets-civil-society-groups/|accessdate=November 22, 2015|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=November 21, 2015}} He also participated in a meeting with leaders of the [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN]] Summit, as well as separate meetings with [[Prime Minister of Laos|Lao Prime Minister]] [[Thongsing Thammavong]] and [[Prime Minister of Singapore|Singaporean Prime Minister]] [[Lee Hsien Loong]]. |- |{{flagicon|FRA}} [[France]] |[[Paris]] |November 29 – December 1 |President Obama participated in the [[2015 United Nations Climate Change Conference]].{{cite news|last1=Cama|first1=Timothy|title=Obama to visit climate pact talks in Paris|url=http://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/259556-obama-to-visit-climate-pact-talks-in-paris|accessdate=November 15, 2015|work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]]|date=November 9, 2015}} On the sidelines of the conference, he joined [[President of France|President]] [[François Hollande]] and [[List of mayors of Paris|Paris Mayor]] [[Anne Hidalgo]] in paying respects to the victims of the [[November 2015 Paris attacks|Paris attacks]] by laying flowers in front of the [[Bataclan (theatre)|Bataclan]].{{cite news|title=Obama, Hollande pay respects to Paris attack victims|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/obama-hollande-pay-respects-to-paris-attack-victims/|accessdate=November 30, 2015|work=[[The Times of Israel]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=November 30, 2015}} Obama held separate bilateral meetings with [[President of the People's Republic of China|Chinese President]] [[Xi Jinping]] and [[Prime Minister of India|Indian Prime Minister]] [[Narendra Modi]] to "send a strong message to the world about their strong commitment to climate change," being three of the [[List of countries by carbon dioxide emissions|world's largest carbon dioxide emitters]].{{cite news|last1=Iyengar|first1=Rishi|title=President Obama Will Meet China’s Xi Jinping and India’s Narendra Modi at the Paris Climate Talks|url=http://time.com/4126723/obama-xi-modi-paris-climate-talks/|accessdate=November 26, 2015|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=November 24, 2015}} Obama also met with [[President of Turkey|Turkish President]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] to discuss their [[Military intervention against ISIL|intervention]] against [[ISIL]], as well as to urge the reduction of tensions between Turkey and Russia following the [[2015 Russian Sukhoi Su-24 shootdown|Russian Sukhoi Su-24 shootdown]] by the [[Turkish Air Force]].{{cite news|last1=Mason|first1=Jeff|title=Obama urges Turkey to reduce tensions with Russia|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/12/01/us-mideast-crisis-obama-turkey-idUSKBN0TK3YP20151201#8OSQoXMVGPmuTCqb.97|accessdate=December 2, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=December 1, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[San Bernardino, California|San Bernardino]] |December 18 |While en route to [[Honolulu]] for the First Family's Christmas vacation, President Obama stopped by San Bernardino, California to meet privately with the families of the victims of the [[2015 San Bernardino attack|San Bernardino attack]].{{cite news|title=Obama to meet families of San Bernardino victims|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/1011514/obama-to-meet-families-of-san-bernardino-victims/|accessdate=December 18, 2015|work=[[The Express Tribune]]|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=December 17, 2015}} |} ==References== {{Reflist|35em}} {{Barack Obama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Presidential Trips Made By Barack Obama during 2015}}
